results.title: [Raymond Penington Home Movies: Reel 3]
results.brief_description:
The Raymond Penington Home Movie Collection is a collection of 16mm colour and black-and-white films made between 1938 and 1965. Dr. Raymond Penington (born 1903) was a medical doctor from Melbourne, Victoria. He and his wife Edith lived in Papua New Guinea in the late 1920s before returning to Melbourne in 1931 and settling in Canterbury. They had three children, Margaret, Vivienne and Jocelyn. His home movies focus on family life in Melbourne and holidays in regional Victoria.

Travelling between Port Campbell in Victoria and South Australia’s Port McDonnell, this film follows the Penington family’s trip along the West Victorian coastline.

Included are the Port Campbell cliffs, Great Ocean Road’s ‘The Blow Hole’, ‘Loch Ard Gorge’ and ‘London Bridge’ (now known as the London Arch and the Twelve Apostles).

Other places visited include Warrnambool, Port Fairy, Portland, Mt Gambier, Port McDonnell (SA) and Cape Nelson.

The film shows a number of vehicles from the 1950s and fashion from the time; however, the majority of the film is scenery.

Buildings of interest include the Fletcher Jones Plus 8 building and Gardens in Warrnambool, ‘Hotel Richmond, The original home of the Henty’s’ and Custom House, Port McDonnell.

The film finishes with a semi-fade to black shot of the back of the Penington family caravan and title card ‘The End’.

Selected highlights list:
00:00:06:00 Port Campbell, sea cliffs, Sherbrook River and the Twelve apostles
00:06:13:00 Warrnambool Welcome Sign
00:07:56:00 FJ Plus 8 industries - Fletcher Jones Garden, Warrnambool
00:09:49:00 Margaret and Ray Penington on the Rocks looking out to sea, Port Fairy
00:12:20:00 Margaret, Vivienne and Jocelyn Penington on the docks, Portland
00:12:41:00 long shot looking along Henty Street out to sea with the All Saints Catholic Church in view and old 50s cars can be seen driving along it
00:13:03:00 Pennington girls greeting each other on either side of the south Australian Border Sign
00:13:56:00 scenes of Brown, Valley and Blue Lakes, Mt Gambier
00:16:35:00 rook wall and Lookout (Built in 1918), Mt Gambier
00:19:51:00 scenes of the Penington women walking through Cape Nelson Park

results.title: [Raymond Penington Home Movies: Reel 2]
results.brief_description:
The Raymond Penington Home Movie Collection is a collection of 16mm colour and black-and-white films made between 1938 and 1965. Dr. Raymond Penington (born 1903) was a medical doctor from Melbourne, Victoria. He and his wife Edith lived in Papua New Guinea in the late 1920s before returning to Melbourne in 1931 and settling in Canterbury. They had three children, Margaret, Vivienne and Jocelyn. His home movies focus on family life in Melbourne and holidays in regional Victoria.

This film is set at the Grampians, Victoria. It begins at Halls Gap Caravan park and then continues with highlights of the Grampians including Coronation Chair, Ladies Hat, The Jaws of Death and The Pinnacle.

Each scene has been meticulously titled to indicate the whereabouts within the Grampians.

There is a scene of the original shopping strip and Taylor’s Store and Café and a few old cars of the era and earlier can be seen.

Towards the end of the film is a number of beautiful images of fauna and flora of the area including the Golden Wattle and Banksia.

At one point you can see the Penington girls practising dissection of a rabbit and a scene of them riding horses.

The film ends with the title “And so Home”.

Selected highlights list:
00:00:53:00 Taylor’s Store and Café, Main street, Halls Gap showing old Vintage cars
00:02:32:00 the three Penington girls washing up and doing a rabbit dissection
00:03:23:00 Penington Family sitting in the trees reading
00:05:02:00 Penington family on Mount Victory and the views from the rock
00:05:31:00 Jaws of Death, Grampians
00:06:19:00 Coronation Chair
00:08:31:00 eldest Penington daughter trying to do a flying pose in front of McKenzie falls
00:10:28:00 scenes of rock formation, Grand Canyon
00:12:30:00 Ladies Hat. rock formation
00:14:28:00 flora and fauna from the Grampian area
00:20:07:00 eldest Penington girls holding dead rabbits

results.title: [Raymond Penington Home Movies: Reel 1]
results.brief_description:
The Raymond Penington Home Movie Collection is a collection of 16mm colour and black-and-white films made between 1938 and 1965. Dr. Raymond Penington (born 1903) was a medical doctor from Melbourne, Victoria. He and his wife Edith lived in Papua New Guinea in the late 1920s before returning to Melbourne in 1931 and settling in Canterbury. They had three children, Margaret, Vivienne and Jocelyn. His home movies focus on family life in Melbourne and holidays in regional Victoria.

This film shows the Penington family visiting several animal sanctuaries in Victoria, Australia. The film is a good example of animal captivity and fashions of the 1940s.

The film begins at Melbourne Zoo with the zoo entrance (built in 1939). The famous elephant Queenie who gave rides for over 40 years is shown. This would have been shortly before she killed her trainer by accident in 1943 leading to her being put down.

There are a number of scenes with the three Penington girls, Margaret, Viviene and Jocelyn, feeding animals. Scenes of monkeys and wallabies amongst other animals are also shown.

The film then moves to Balwyn Wildlife sanctuary with scenes of a monkey circus, pony and dog show. A baboon in clothes doing tricks appears to be the main attraction.

The film then moves to Badger Creek Sanctuary (later called Healesville sanctuary) where platypuses, emus, eagles and koalas are seen.

The film finishes with seals playing in their enclosure.

Selected highlights list:
00:00:04:00 Melbourne Zoo Entrance
00:00:17:00 Mrs Penington, Margaret, Viviene and Jocelyn walking along garden path at the zoo. Mrs Penington is pushing an old fashioned stroller.
00:00:25:00 Penington girls feeding a number of different animals, riding Queenie the elephant and on the Merry-go-round
00:04:59:00 animals being directed to perform tricks by man with a stick including monkeys, dogs and monkeys riding ponies
00:06:08:00 TITLE: “Wild Life – Balwyn.” followed by numerous animals of the Sanctuary
00:07:12:00 monkey circus
00:08:21:00 baboon in clothes rocking in a rocking chair and rides a bike
00:09:17:00 lyrebird foraging in the forest with sparrows, Badger Creek Sanctuary
00:10:18:00 koala with baby eating in a eucalyptus tree
00:10:54:00 platypuses being hand fed in enclosure
00:12:12:00 seals in enclosure playing

results.title: [Robert Lennox Suggett Collection]
results.brief_description: This collection consists of two short, silent 16mm films made by Australian photographer Robert Lennox Suggett in the 1960s. One shows the construction of the water tower in Warrnambool, Victoria, in 1967, while the other features footage shot in London between 1963 and 1964.
results.description: This collection consists of two short, silent 16mm films made by Australian photographer Robert Lennox Suggett in the 1960s. One shows the construction of the water tower in Warrnambool, Victoria, in 1967, while the other features footage shot in London between 1963 and 1964.
description_for_label: This collection consists of two short, silent 16mm films made by Australian photographer Robert Lennox Suggett in the 1960s. One shows the construction of the water tower in Warrnambool, Victoria, in 1967, while the other features footage shot in London between 1963 and 1964.
results.media_note: Sorry, we don't have images or video for this item.

group_works.title: [Construction of the Water Tower at Fletcher Jones Factory, Warrnambool, 1967]

results.title: [London, 1963 - 1964]
results.brief_description:
This silent, black-and-white footage of some of the major landmarks of London was shot in 1963–1964 by Australian photographer Robert Lennox Suggett.

Opens with the Royal Marines Band playing, filmed as they march past the Duke of York Column and Waterloo Steps.

00:00:46:00 then Prime Minister of the United Kingdom, Alec Douglas-Home, farewelling a visitor on the steps of Number 10 Downing Street (the headquarters of British government).

00:01:11:00 camera pans down Nelson’s Column (a monument in Trafalgar Square, central London, commemorating Admiral Horatio Nelson.) We then see scenes of Trafalgar Square, with the National Gallery building and fountain both visible.

00:01:22:00 camera lingers on the equestrian statue of King Charles I, with the church of St Martin-in-the-Fields in the background.

00:01:28:00 London traffic, with the camera focussing especially on cabs (taxis).

00:01:43:00 the Admiralty Arch.

00:01:49:00 double-decker London bus in front of some classic 1960’s style adverstising signs in Piccadilly Circus, with the Eros statue visible.

00:02:04:00 Eros statue in close-up.

00:02:22:00 Underground (railway) sign in close-up, followed by scenes in the Underground itself; ticket queues, escalators, and a train coming into a platform.

00:02:46:00 “Piccadilly Circus” station sign visible on the wall of the train tunnel

The film ends with footage of the tunnel, shot from the moving train.

group_siblings.title: [Construction of the Water Tower at Fletcher Jones Factory, Warrnambool, 1967]

production_dates.notes: Creation date recorded on donated film can.

results.title: [Construction of the Water Tower at Fletcher Jones Factory, Warrnambool, 1967]
results.brief_description:
The Fletcher Jones factory and Gardens at 61–81 Flaxman Street, Warrnambool (established 1948) are famous local landmarks and symbolic of the radical approach to industrial relations and the provision of workplace amenities taken by the famous Australian company. The complex, including the Water Tower, was listed on the Victorian Heritage Register in 2006 in recognition of its historic and social significance which notes “…the unusual and successful integration of surplus military structures, buildings and modernist facade in a factory setting. They reflect the resourcefulness and dynamism of Fletcher Jones in the use of war surplus structures and objects during a time of building material shortages.”

The forty-metre-high water tower – built for fire protection and as a booster system – was designed and supervised by Ralph Jones Construction Engineering Services between 1965–1967. [Source: University of Melbourne Archives: Ralph Jones Water Tower Submission and Business Papers].

This silent, black-and-white footage of the tower’s construction was photographed by Australian photographer Robert Lennox Suggett. It is a unique historic documentary record of the construction of an iconic feature of Warrnambool’s – and Victoria’s – industrial heritage.

The forty-metre-high water tower – built for fire protection and as a booster system – was designed and supervised by Ralph Jones Construction Engineering Services between 1965–1967. [Source: University of Melbourne Archives: Ralph Jones Water Tower Submission and Business Papers].

The complex, including the Water Tower, was listed on the Victorian Heritage Register in 2006 in recognition of its historic and social significance which notes “…the unusual and successful integration of surplus military structures, buildings and modernist facade in a factory setting. They reflect the resourcefulness and dynamism of Fletcher Jones in the use of war surplus structures and objects during a time of building material shortages.”

The forty-metre-high water tower – built for fire protection and as a booster system – was designed and supervised by Ralph Jones Construction Engineering Services between 1965–1967. [Source: University of Melbourne Archives: Ralph Jones Water Tower Submission and Business Papers].

This silent, black-and-white footage of the tower’s construction was photographed by Australian photographer Robert Lennox Suggett. It is a unique historic documentary record of the construction of an iconic feature of Warrnambool’s – and Victoria’s – industrial heritage.

results.title: [Charles Hayes Home Movie Collection]
results.material_description:
5 x 400ft 9.5mm B&W silent home movies
7 x 8mm reels (4 x 100ft, 2 x 400ft)
results.brief_description:
The Charles Hayes Home Movie Collection is a collection of home movies originally made on 8mm and 9.5mm film between the 1940s and 1970s by Charles Edward Hayes (1914–1993). The resulting footage shows us the life of a family living in Heathmont in Melbourne’s south east with their many pets and farm animals, their family holidays and gatherings, their suburb and their cars as well as scenes from Melbourne at the time.

Charles Edward Hayes was born on 28th March 1914 and grew up in Port Melbourne. In 1928 he joined Johns & Waygood in City Road, South Melbourne where he worked his way up from office boy to the machine shop becoming a fitter. In 1942 he was nominated to take charge of Johns & Waygood Munitions Annex in Montague making 10lb mortar bombs.

In the late 1940s, Charles purchased his first 9.5mm movie camera starting a hobby that would bring years of enjoyment. In November 1949 Charles purchased an Austin A40 car which he kept until 1973 – it also makes an appearance or two in the home movies! On the 11th November 1950, the family purchased a property at Miller Road, Heathmont, comprising 5 acres of land. They decided to build some sheds and try at being poultry farmers. Charles continued travelling to South Melbourne to work until 1956 when they became full time farmers.

Over the years the family had numerous cows, duck, pigs, sheep, dogs, cats and of course Ticka the cockatoo; all these animals were treated as pets. For socialising and fitness Charles with his wife Elsie, joined the local tennis club and enjoyed playing at the weekend. In 1958 Charles joined the Ringwood Movie Club through some friends and enjoyed the friendship of the club and continued to record their travels with his trusty home movie camera. In 1966 Charles went on to work for Nutritional Products in Mitcham, so they eased out of the poultry business.

Their daughter Olwyn married John Baker on the 9th July, 1967 and had two sons. Elenor married Ron Peach on 2nd April 1970 and had two daughters – Elenor kindly donated the films to ACMI. Elise and Charles were happily married more than 50 years, until he passed away in 1993. These films remain testament to a happy and hard-working family from Melbourne’s outer eastern suburbs.

This home movie collection was donated to ACMI by the filmmaker’s daughter, Elenor Peach.

images.caption: [Charles Hayes Home Movies: Reel 3] (Charles Hayes) Digital Access Still

results.title: [Charles Hayes Home Movies: Reel 12]
results.brief_description:
The Charles Hayes Home Movie Collection is a collection of home movies originally made on 8mm and 9.5mm film between the 1940s and 1970s by Charles Edward Hayes (1914–1993). The resulting footage shows us the life of a family living in Heathmont in Melbourne’s south east with their many pets and farm animals, their family holidays and gatherings, their suburb and their cars as well as scenes from Melbourne at the time.

This film shows snippets of family life while at play, at birthday celebrations and on holiday. We see the family drive across the bridge to Phillip Island and enjoy swimming and canoeing at the beach there. The reel also includes scenes of caravan camping, koalas and a trip to the war memorial at Mount Macedon. The family enjoy games of tennis, ball games and swings and roundabouts at a playground. The film includes good examples of fashion, Austin cars and recreational activities of the time.

Originally made using 9.5mm film.

Selected Highlights List (time codes from Access Overscan)

00:01:37:00 children with their dad in the water at the beach (good example of bathing fashion)
00:02:58:00 tennis match between mum and dad
00:04:29:00 car with caravan and family in bush camp setting
00:05:14:00 Austin car with family standing at the front talking and combing hair
00:05:58:00 children being pushed on swings in a park by their mother (good fashion and sunglasses references)
00:7:30:00 close-up of little girl’s face as she blows out her birthday candles and looks to camera
00:07:41:00 family in front of war memorial at Mount Macedon
00:08:36:00 steam train travelling on a country rail line
00:08:46:00 family looking out from a ferry window
00:08:52:00 kids on a roundabout at a playground
00:09:00:00 grandmother, mother and children sitting on a playground wall – the grandmother is shooting a water pistol.
00:09:08:00 children on playground roundabout and dad jumps on to join them
00:09:32:00 a koala sitting in a tree climbs to the top and looks down
00:09:45:00 family and friends stand in front of a picket fence (good example of family groups and fashion from the time)
00:10:01:00 wide shot as cars travel across the bridge to Phillip Island

00:10:14:00 POV from inside car as it drives over the Phillip Island bridge

results.title: [Charles Hayes Home Movies: Reel 11]
results.brief_description:
The Charles Hayes Home Movie Collection is a collection of home movies originally made on 8mm and 9.5mm film between the 1940s and 1970s by Charles Edward Hayes (1914–1993). The resulting footage shows us the life of a family living in Heathmont in Melbourne’s south east with their many pets and farm animals, their family holidays and gatherings, their suburb and their cars as well as scenes from Melbourne at the time.

This film shows Sydney street, harbour and beach scenes and a family holiday to Tasmania and New Zealand. There are scenes of Bondi Beach, Taronga Zoo and wild animals in captivity showing a monkey riding a bicycle and performing tricks with a trainer. There are scenes on board and farewelling a passenger liner and passenger steam ferries in Sydney Harbour.

There are street scenes around Hobart, including Wrest Point Hotel, and a road trip to Mount Wellington, showing views along the way. The film shows New Zealand port towns and ports as well as a tourist boat trip on the fjords and scenery at Milford Sound. The family visits Rotorua and a recreation of a Maori Village depicting traditional Maori dance and dress performed for tourists. There are also scenes on a cruise ship of recreational activities.

Originally made using 9.5mm film.

Selected Highlights List (time codes from Access Overscan)

00:00:00:00 Bondi Beach scene panorama showing beach and bathers
00:00:21:00 Sydney/Bondi street scenes showing cars, pedestrians and double decker bus
00:00:34:00 Taronga Zoo showing caged monkeys, birds, camels, zebra, impala, giraffes
00:01:15:00 horses, dogs and monkeys in costumes riding bicycles, doing tricks with trainer
00:01:56:00 farewelling a passenger liner with streamers at Sydney Harbour
00:02:21:00 crowded Sydney steam ferry at Sydney Harbour
00:02:51:00 Wrest Point Hotel, “Portlight Bar” sign with street and water scenes showing cars and pedestrians
00:03:11:00 Tasmanian Road sign indicating direction and distance to Tasman Highway, Lindisfarne, Cambridge Aerodrome, Bellerive
00:03:31:00 family group facing camera at lookout point on Mount Wellington (good fashion reference)
00:03:50:00 people on Mount Wellington look-out point taking photos with camera mounted on wooden tripod
00:03:59:00 Milford Sound tourist boat trip footage showing fjord and surrounding mountains, waterfalls, light planes flying, tourists on boat
00:05:25:00 New Zealand Port Town – possibly Wellington, showing rooftops and harbour
00:05:32:00 Wellington Cable Car, New Zealand
00:05:34:00 signage for Wellington Council Cable Car and entrance to Botanical Gardens

00:06:00:00 New Zealand street scenes showing buildings, pedestrians and cars
00:06:12:00 Orsova passenger ship in New Zealand port
00:06:29:00 ships, ferry and rower in a New Zealand port
00:06:43:00 Frankton Train Station sign

00:07:05:00 Waiariki Wai-Ora baths, showing bathers, signage and bathers around the pool
00:07:12:00 Maori women performing traditional dance for tourists in a recreation of a village

00:07:38:00 male tourist and children pose with Maori women dressed in traditional dress
00:07:42:00 tourist women interact with Maori man dressed in traditional dress
00:07:45:00 Rotorua hot mud pools and geysers with tourists

00:08:46:00 woman on board ship sitting in deck chair posing with Orsova London Life Saving ring around her neck

results.title: [Charles Hayes Home Movies: Reel 10]
results.brief_description:
The Charles Hayes Home Movie Collection is a collection of home movies originally made on 8mm and 9.5mm film between the 1940s and 1970s by Charles Edward Hayes (1914–1993). The resulting footage shows us the life of a family living in Heathmont in Melbourne’s south east with their many pets and farm animals, their family holidays and gatherings, their suburb and their cars as well as scenes from Melbourne at the time.

This film shows rural Victoria footage around Omeo. It features excavation of, and images of, the Kiewa Hydro Electric scheme including power station interiors and exteriors and dam footage. Also included are hobby farm images, of children and adults with calves and chickens and pet dogs and cats. There is footage of a man collecting cow manure from paddocks.

We see images of the Royal Melbourne Agricultural Show Grand Parade with goats, horses, Ayrshire and Illawarra cattle, jinkers, floats, horse-drawn carts with advertising. There is also footage of children playing childhood games on the family farm – wheelbarrow races, chasey, ball games and piggy-backs.

Originally made using 9.5mm film.

Selected Highlights List (time codes from Access Overscan):

00:00:01:00 children feeding chickens on farm
00:00:11:00 child sitting on cow and falling off as cow stands
00:00:30:00 family and friends with farm animals
00:00:48:00 man working on farm with shovel collecting cow manure
00:00:59:00 two children with kitten fighting over who gets to hold it
00:01:15:00 children playing chasing, running games around trees in rural setting
00:01:26:00 children with grandmother playing with skipping rope in rural setting (good family images and fashion example)
00:01:35:00 family on ship with crew working in background
00:02:11:00 Maroondah Dam plaque with reservoir details
00:02:46:00 men and children playing piggy back, wheelbarrow races, ball games on rural property (ood footage of childhood games and playing)
00:03:15:00 child and woman on farm with calves (good rural footage and fashion example)
00:05:11:00 Royal Melbourne Agricultural Show Grand Parade including Ayrshire and Illawara cattle and goats
00:05:17:00 Royal Melbourne Agricultural Show Grand Parade with Jinkers, horses and carts, floats and advertising carts
00:08:19:00 Carnation Milk factory interior and exterior
00:08:57:00 Mount Beauty postal address plaque
00:10:01:00 rural footage of Kiewa Hydroelectric scheme, including images of interior and exterior power station, electricity poles and dam
00:10:33:00 road sign with vintage car in background: road sign indicating Upper Kiewa Valley Road; Mt Beauty; Rocky Valley; Howmans Gap
